alert.note: Alert for Bradford; Eastern Alachua; Union (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Jacksonville (Northeast Florida and Southeast Georgia)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued March 12 at 9:41PM EDT by NWS Jacksonville
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Bradford, northeastern Alachua, Union and northwestern Clay Counties through 1030 PM EDT... At 941 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 7 miles northeast of Raiford to Upland Pines. Movement was east at 35 mph. HAZARD...Winds around 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Starke, Lake Butler, Raiford, Worthington Spring, Middleburg, Worthington Springs, Groves, New River, Oakleaf Plantation and Providence. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
